p: The first study describing the use of high-throughput sequencing for exploring the virome of dogs dates back to 2011 ( Li et al., 2011). Deep sequencing of nucleic acids from the feces of 18 diarrheic dogs were identified as known canine parvoviruses, coronaviruses, and RVs. Also, the study discovered the genomes of canine kobuvirus ( Picornaviridae) and sapovirus ( Caliciviridae). Canine sapovirus constituted a novel genogroup within the genus Sapovirus, a group of viruses also associated with human and animal diarrhea.
